DataElement.preferredName: Therapeutic Procedure Seizure Intent For Prophylaxis Phenytoin Or Fosphenytoin Administered Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to a therapeutic procedure where Phenytoin or Fosphenytoin were administered to prevent seizure.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Therapeutic Procedure Seizure Intent For Prophylaxis Phenytoin Or Fosphenytoin Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a therapeutic procedure where Phenytoin or Fosphenytoin were administered to prevent seizure (cortical seizure foci spreading to adjacent areas, stabilizing the threshold against hyperexcitability).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Property.preferredName: Seizure Intent For Prophylaxis Phenytoin Or Fosphenytoin Administered
Property.preferredDefinition: Sudden, involuntary skeletal muscular contractions of cerebral or brain stem origin.--2004:Drug use is intended to reduce the risk of developing a disease or condition.:A hydantoin derivative and a non-sedative antiepileptic agent with anticonvulsant activity. Phenytoin potentially acts by promoting sodium efflux from neurons located in the motor cortex reducing post-tetanic potentiation at synapses. The reduction of potentiation prevents cortical seizure foci spreading to adjacent areas, stabilizing the threshold against hyperexcitability. In addition, this agent appears to reduce sensitivity of muscle spindles to stretch causing muscle relaxation.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:No Value Exists:The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Concepts.definition: Sudden, involuntary skeletal muscular contractions of cerebral or brain stem origin.
The use of a particular medical device, medication or treatment to help reduce the risk of contracting or developing a disease or condition.

A hydantoin derivative and a non-sedative antiepileptic agent with anticonvulsant activity. Phenytoin potentially acts by promoting sodium efflux from neurons located in the motor cortex reducing post-tetanic potentiation at synapses. The reduction of potentiation prevents cortical seizure foci spreading to adjacent areas, stabilizing the threshold against hyperexcitability. In addition, this agent appears to reduce sensitivity of muscle spindles to stretch causing muscle relaxation.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.

A water-soluble phosphate ester prodrug of phenytoin, a hydantoin derivative with anticonvulsant activity. Fosphenytoin is hydrolyzed to phenytoin by phosphatases. Phenytoin exerts its effect mainly by promoting sodium efflux and stabilizes neuronal membranes in the motor cortex. This leads to a suppression of excessive neuronal firing and limits the spread of seizure activity.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
